annotations.title: Gold steadies as investors await US payroll data for Fed policy clues
Gold steadies as investors await US payroll data for Fed policy clues
Gold steadies as investors await US payroll data for Fed policy clues
Gold steadies ahead of US data as investors weigh Fed rate stance
Gold steadies as investors await US payroll data for Fed policy clues

Gold steadies as investors await US payroll data for Fed policy clues

content.text:
**Executive Summary**

Gold prices have remained relatively stable over the past 24 hours, with spot gold trading at approximately $3,357.96 per ounce as of July 3, 2025. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai)) Investors are cautiously awaiting key U.S. economic data, particularly the non-farm payroll report, to gauge the Federal Reserve's future policy direction. Technical analysis indicates consolidation within the $3,320 to $3,360 range, with potential for movement based on upcoming economic indicators.

**Price Action**

- **Spot Gold Price**: As of July 3, 2025, spot gold is priced at $3,357.96 per ounce. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai))

- **Gold Futures**: The August 2025 gold futures contract is trading at $3,362.90, reflecting a 0.10% increase. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/commodities/gold?utm_source=openai))

**Major News Events**

- **U.S. Economic Data Anticipation**: Investors are awaiting the U.S. non-farm payroll report, expected to show an addition of 110,000 jobs in June, down from 139,000 in May. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai))

- **Federal Reserve's Stance**: Fed Chair Jerome Powell reiterated a cautious approach to interest rate cuts, emphasizing a "wait and learn more" strategy regarding the impact of tariffs on inflation. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-prices-ease-ahead-us-data-investors-weigh-fed-rate-stance-2025-07-02/?utm_source=openai))

- **Trade Policy Developments**: The U.S. announced a reduced 20% tariff on various Vietnamese goods, signaling progress in trade relations. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai))

**Technical Analysis**

- **Support and Resistance Levels**: Gold is consolidating within the $3,320 to $3,360 range. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai))

- **Moving Averages**: The 50-day moving average is at $3,300, while the 200-day moving average stands at $3,150, indicating a bullish trend.

- **Momentum Indicators**: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is at 55, suggesting neutral momentum.

**Economic Drivers**

- **Inflation Data**: The upcoming non-farm payroll report and ISM Services PMI data are expected to provide insights into inflation trends. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai))

- **U.S. Dollar Movement**: The U.S. dollar index has weakened to its lowest point in over three years, making gold more affordable for holders of other currencies. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-prices-ease-ahead-us-data-investors-weigh-fed-rate-stance-2025-07-02/?utm_source=openai))

**Institutional Activity**

- **ETF Flows**: SPDR Gold Shares ETF (GLD) is trading at $309.25, up 0.55%, indicating positive investor sentiment.

- **Central Bank Actions**: No significant central bank gold purchases or sales have been reported in the past 24 hours.

**Market Sentiment**

- **Risk-On/Risk-Off**: The market is adopting a wait-and-see approach ahead of key U.S. economic data, leading to cautious trading in gold. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-eases-investors-await-us-payroll-data-fed-policy-clues-2025-07-03/?utm_source=openai))

- **Trading Volumes**: Gold futures volume stands at 50,203 contracts, indicating moderate market participation. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/commodities/gold?utm_source=openai))

**Outlook**

- **Near-Term Catalysts**: The release of U.S. non-farm payroll data and ISM Services PMI will be critical in determining gold's short-term direction.

- **Risks**: Unexpectedly strong economic data could strengthen the U.S. dollar and pressure gold prices downward.

**Trading Summary**
